SENT.plain: Dural sinus thrombosis is a rare complication of pregnancy and the puerperium
We report a case of dural sinus thrombosis that presented as a persistent headache and then a new-onset seizure in a previously healthy 28-year-old woman 3 months postpartum
Subtle changes consistent with sinus thrombosis were present on noncontrast computed tomography, but magnetic resonance venography ultimately confirmed the diagnosis
Anticonvulsant and anticoagulant therapy were initiated and maintained, and the patient recovered completely
Follow-up genetic analysis revealed heterozygosity for the Factor II 20210A variant of the prothrombin gene mutation
